channel.title: Resources on C-MOOR
channel.description: Recent content in Resources on C-MOOR

item.title: Resources
item.description: Scroll down or click on any of these topics to see suggested resources for learning more: Biology Next Generation Sequencing RNA-seq Statistics Machine Learning R

item.title: Biology
item.description: Crash Course has several videos explaining biology concepts. We recommend the following videos in particular if you’d like to work on sequence analysis: Animal Cells Biological Molecules DNA structure Transcription and Translation Some additional videos on genes and genomes: Harvard, “An Introduction to the Human Genome” Scientific American, “Genes vs. DNA vs. Chromosomes”

item.title: Next Generation Sequencing
item.description: Rafa Irizarry, “Intro to Next Generation Sequencing” Ben Langmead, “Intro to Alignment” Visualizing genomic data with IGV NCBI, “The FASTQ File Format”: A common, standard format for sequencing data Sequencing Technologies: The following videos give an overview of the technical process of different modern sequencing strategies Illumina: Short reads, high accuracy, high throughput Nanopore: Very long reads, lower accuracy, moderate throughput Sanger: Long reads, high accuracy, very low throughput

item.title: RNA-seq
item.description: Introductory videos Rafa Irizarry, “Intro to RNA-seq” (5 min) Kasper Hansen, “Introduction to RNAseq” (1 hr 17 min) Online texts RNA-seqlopedia: “The RNA-seqlopedia provides an overview of RNA-seq and of the choices necessary to carry out a successful RNA-seq experiment.” It provides a good background and overview but does not go into the practical details of how to do the various data analysis steps (what programs to use and how to use them).

item.title: Statistics
item.description: Videos StatQuest: A collection of videos explaining a variety of statistics concepts and methods. Rafa Irizarry, “Introduction to Statistics” Online textbooks Modern Statistics for Modern Biology Statistical Modeling: A Fresh Approach

item.title: Machine Learning
item.description: The Elements of Statistical Learning Convolutional Neural Networks for Visual Recognition fast.ai Google AI

item.title: R
item.description: R for Data Science “This book will teach you how to do data science with R: You’ll learn how to get your data into R, get it into the most useful structure, transform it, visualise it and model it.” swirl: “swirl teaches you R programming and data science interactively, at your own pace, and right in the R console!” DataCamp Introduction to R: “In this introduction to R, you will master the basics of this beautiful open source language, including factors, lists and data frames.
